Ruby.name: 红宝石
Ruby.description: 在燃指峰的一个箱子里发现的一颗红宝石。

Sapphire.name: 蓝宝石
Sapphire.description: 在正义营地的便坑里发现的一块蓝宝石，其所属者是一名死去的圣殿骑士。

Wand of Fear.name: 恐惧魔杖
Wand of Fear.description:
魔杖（需同调）

该魔杖有 7 发充能，且每天黎明时恢复 1d6 + 1 发已消耗的充能。当充能耗尽时，骰一次 [[/r 1d20]]。如果骰值为 1，魔杖将化为灰烬而毁灭。

命令。持握此魔杖时，你可以用一个动作并消耗 1 发充能以命令一名生物逃跑或趴下（如同@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.arzCrMRgcNiQuh43]{命令术}，豁免 DC 15）。

恐惧力场。持握此魔杖时，你可以用一个动作并消耗 2 发充能，令魔杖尖端发出 60 尺锥状的橙光。锥状区域内的每名生物必须成功通过一次 DC 15 的感知豁免否则对你恐慌 1 分钟。因此效应恐慌的生物每轮必须以其移动力尽可能远离你且无法自愿进入你周围 30 尺范围内。使用自己的动作时，它只能执行疾走动作或是尝试逃离某种阻止它移动的效应。它无法执行反应。如果无处可逃，则它会可以执行闪避动作。受此效应影响的生物在其每轮结束时可以再次尝试豁免，成功则终止自己身上的相关效应。

Pouch (10 gp).name: 钱包（10 GP）
Pouch (10 gp).description: 一个布袋或皮袋最多可容纳 20 发弹弓子弹或 50 支吹箭针等物品。用于存放法术材料的分隔式袋子被称为材料袋。一个袋子最多可容纳 1/5 立方尺或 6 磅的装备。

Spell Scroll: Purify Food and Drink.name: 法术卷轴：净化食粮
Spell Scroll: Purify Food and Drink.description:
1 环&Reference[Spell Scroll]

你指定施法距离内一点，净化指定点周围半径 5 尺球状区域内的非魔法饮食品，并驱除其浸染的所有毒素和疾病。

Arrow +1.name: 箭矢 +1
Arrow +1.description:
适用于各种弓箭的弹药。它被注入了魔力。

你使用此魔法弹药进行的攻击和伤害检定将获得加值。一旦命中目标，该弹药就不再具有魔法属性。

Sephirius’s Pouch.name: 塞菲留斯的小包
Sephirius’s Pouch.description: 一个布袋或皮袋最多可容纳 20 发弹弓子弹或 50 支吹箭针等物品。用于存放法术材料的分隔式袋子被称为材料袋。一个袋子最多可容纳 1/5 立方尺或 6 磅的装备。

Lord Brixton’s Pouch.name: 布里克斯顿勋爵的小包

Potion of Healing.name: 治疗药水
Potion of Healing.description:
药水的红色液体在摇晃时会闪闪发光。/em>

当你饮下这瓶药水时恢复 2d4 + 2 生命值。

Opal.name: 蛋白石
Opal.description: 在正义营地的便坑里发现的一块蛋白石，其所属者是一名死去的圣殿骑士。

Leatherworker's Tools.name: 皮匠工具
Leatherworker's Tools.description:
这些工具包含皮匠所需的物品。

如果你熟练掌握某种工匠工具，则可将你的熟练加值加到你使用该工具进行任何工艺工作的属性检定上。每种工匠工具所需的熟练度各不相同。

Longsword.name: 长剑
Longsword.description:
[[/attack extended]]。[[/damage extended average]]或双手使用造成[[/damage twoHanded average]]伤害。

这把剑具有一种微弱的魔法属性：持有者能获得说和理解龙语的能力。

4vWnKFrBQcYr179F.name: 蓝宝石
4vWnKFrBQcYr179F.description: 在燃指峰的一个箱子里发现的一颗蓝宝石。

Torch.name: 火把
Torch.description: 火把点燃后能够燃烧 1 小时，燃烧期间发出 20 尺半径的明亮光照和额外 20 尺的微光光照。当你执行攻击动作时，你可以将火把当作简易近战武器，并使用火把发动攻击。命中时，目标受到 1 点火焰伤害。

Arrow.name: 箭矢
Arrow.description: 各种弓的标准弹药。这些普通的箭由光滑的木箭杆、鹅毛箭羽和锤形金属箭头制成。

Dwarven Battleaxe +1.name: 矮人战斧 +1
Dwarven Battleaxe +1.description:
[[/attack extended]]。[[/damage extended average]]或双手使用造成[[/damage twoHanded average]]伤害。

该武器能在水上和其他液体上漂浮，使持有者在进行力量（运动）检定游泳时获得优势。战斧的柄上刻着矮人语的德特赫克符文，拼出了这件武器的名字：鲍勃。

Dark Blue Crystal Eye.name: 深蓝色水晶眼球
Dark Blue Crystal Eye.description: 你在九神之墓中的艾金之墓获得了这颗深蓝色水晶眼球。

Spell Scroll: Fabricate.name: 法术卷轴：鬼斧神工
Spell Scroll: Fabricate.description:
4 环&Reference[Spell Scroll]

你将一种原材料转化成该材料制作的成品。例如，你可以将一丛树木转化为一座木桥，一把麻草化为绳子，或是将亚麻和羊毛化作衣物。

指定施法距离内你能看见的原材料。只要有足够的材料，你就可以将他们转化为一件体型不超过大型的物件（至多占据 10 尺立方区域或八个相邻的 5 尺立方区域）。如果你的目标材料是金属、石料或者其他矿石材料，那么被制造的物件不能大于中型（至多占据 5 尺立方区域），制成品的质量和原材料质量相同。

该法术不能创造生物或魔法物品。你只有对制作某物品的工匠工具拥有熟练时，才能使用此法术去制作相应需要高工艺水平制作的物品，如武器、护甲等。

Zaroum Al-Sarya Scimitar.name: 扎如姆·艾萨亚克弯刀
Zaroum Al-Sarya Scimitar.description:
[[/attack extended]]。[[/damage extended average]]。

这把弯刀的刀柄上镶嵌着宝石，靠近缠绕的刀柄处较窄，但向闪闪发光的刀尖处逐渐变宽。

Wooden Map Case.name: 木制地图盒
Wooden Map Case.description: 一个木箱，里面装着一张通往废墟或地牢的地图。

Hempen Rope (50 ft.).name: 麻绳 (50 尺)
Hempen Rope (50 ft.).description: 麻质或者丝质的绳索，拥有 2 点生命值，且可以通过一次成功的DC 17 力量检定扯断。

Pink Crystal Eye.name: 粉红色水晶眼球
Pink Crystal Eye.description: 你在九神之墓中的魔像陷坑获得了这颗粉红色水晶眼球。

Potion of Greater Healing.name: 高等治疗药水
Potion of Greater Healing.description:
药水的红色液体在摇晃时会闪闪发光。

当你喝下这瓶药水时，你会恢复 4d4 + 4 点生命值。

Bigby's Hand (Ice).name: 毕格比之手（冰）
Bigby's Hand (Ice).description:
你在施法距离内指定一处你能看见且未被占据的空间，并在该处创造出一只闪烁着微光的大型手掌。巨手在法术持续时间内维持存在，并听从你的命令进行移动，模仿你自己手掌的各类动作。

巨手是一个物件，其 AC 为 20，其生命值等于你的生命值上限。如果它的生命值降至 0 则法术将提前终止。其力量属性为 26（+8），敏捷属性为 10（+0）。巨手并不会充满其所在的空间。

施展此法术时，你可以令巨手移动至多 60 尺远并造成下列效应之一。你也可以在自己随后的回合里以一个附赠动作再造成下列效应之一。

金刚拳 Clenched Fist。 巨手对自身周围 5 尺范围内的一个生物（或物件）发动一次打击。此时，巨掌用你的游戏数据发动一次近战法术攻击，此次攻击命中时目标将受到 4d8 点力场伤害。

飞击掌 。 巨手尝试推撞自身周围 5 尺范围内的一个生物。你使用巨手的力量属性进行一次属性检定，与目标的力量（运动）检定作对抗。如果目标的体型不超过中型，则你的检定具有优势。若你胜出对抗时，目标将目标推动 5+你施法属性调整值的五倍 尺（方向由你选择）。巨手将随着目标一起移动，保持自己处在目标周围 5 尺的范围内。

擒拿掌。 巨手尝试对自身周围 5 尺范围内的一个体型不超过巨型的生物进行擒抱。你使用巨手的力量属性值来处理本次擒抱。如果目标的体型不超过中型，则你的检定具有优势。在巨手擒抱目标期间，你可以使用一个附赠动作命令巨手对其进行挤压，此时目标将受到 2d6 + 你的施法属性调整值 点钝击伤害。

护身掌。 你选择一个生物，巨手将持续阻挡在你与该生物中间，直到你给他新的命令为止。巨手不断移动以保持其始终处于你与目标中间，使得相对目标而言，你具有半身掩护。如果目标的力量值小于或等于巨手的力量值，则其无法穿过巨手的阻挡。而如果其力量值高于巨手，则目标可以穿过巨手所在的空间向你走来，不过该空间对该目标而言视为困难地形。

materials.value: 一块蛋壳和一只蛇鳞手套

Emerald.name: 绿宝石
Emerald.description: 在正义营地的便坑里发现的一块绿宝石，其所属者是一名死去的圣殿骑士。

Quiver.name: 箭袋
Quiver.description: 该箭袋最多能装 20 支箭。它是一个黑色皮制箭袋，上面绣着一颗镶嵌着石英的星图。它是在暗夜巨蛇神殿中芬萨札的房间被发现的。

Small Knife.name: 小刀
Small Knife.description: 学者们用来开启信件与文书往来的钝刀。

Pouch (25 gp).name: 钱包（25 GP）
Pouch (25 gp).description: 一个布袋或皮袋最多可容纳 20 发弹弓子弹或 50 支吹箭针等物品。用于存放法术材料的分隔式袋子被称为材料袋。一个袋子最多可容纳 1/5 立方尺或 6 磅的装备。

Leather-bound Diary.name: 皮面日记本
Leather-bound Diary.description: 一本书可能包含诗歌、历史记载、特定文化领域的信息、关于侏儒装置的图表和注释，或者几乎任何可以用文字或图片表示的内容。

Onyx Gemstone.name: 玛瑙宝石
Onyx Gemstone.description: 在姆巴拉高原的普普奶奶的茅屋里，在人皮口袋里发现的玛瑙宝石。

Explorer's Pack.name: 探索套组
Explorer's Pack.description: 一个背包可以容纳一立方尺或 30 磅的装备。你还可以将一些物品（例如铺盖卷或绳子）绑在背包外面。

Spell Scroll: Commune with Nature.name: 法术卷轴：问道自然
Spell Scroll: Commune with Nature.description:
5 环&Reference[Spell Scroll]

你短暂的成为大自然的一部分并以此获得周围地形的信息。在户外时，该法术可以让你了解 3 里内大地的状况。在洞穴和其他天然地下场所中，其范围缩小为 300 尺半径区域内。自然环境中被建筑覆盖的区域里（比如地下城或城镇中）法术无法生效。

你立即获得的自然资讯至多与该地域三个方面的主题相关，在以下项目中进行选择：

  • 地形和水体
  • 区域内分布的植物，矿物，动物或人物
  • 强大的天界生物，精类生物，邪魔，元素生物或者不死生物
  • 受其他存在位面的影响
  • 建筑物

例如，你可以侦测到某个强大不死生物在区域中的位置，干净安全的水源所在地，以及附近城镇的方位。

Tinderbox.name: 火绒盒
Tinderbox.description: 火绒盒是一种装有打火石、火镰和火绒（通常是浸泡在燃油里的干布料）的小型容器，其中的物品可以用来点火。使用它来点燃蜡烛、油灯、提灯或火把——或任何其他暴露燃料的东西——需要一个动作。点燃任何其他火需要 1 分钟。

Serpent Venom (Injury).name: 蛇毒（损伤）
Serpent Venom (Injury).description:
这种毒素必须从死亡或失能的巨型毒蛇.身上采集。受到该毒素影响的生物必须进行[[/save format=long]]，豁免失败则受到[[/damage average]]伤害，豁免成功则仅受半伤。

损伤。损伤毒素可以涂抹在武器、弹药、陷阱部件和其他造成穿刺或挥砍伤害的物件上，并且在通过伤口注入或被洗掉之前一直保持效力。受到涂有这种毒素的物件造成的穿刺或挥砍伤害的生物会受到其影响。

IZiP1h922lWl4kXg.name: 绿宝石
IZiP1h922lWl4kXg.description: 在独角鲸号残骸里发现的一块祖母绿宝石。

Amulet of Health.name: 健康护符
Amulet of Health.description:
奇物，珍稀（需同调）

佩戴此护符期间，你的体质变为 19。如果你的体质在未佩戴护符时已经大于或等于 19，则护符不会起效。

Amulet of Health.name: 健康护符
Amulet of Health.description: 你的体质变为 19。如果你的体质在未佩戴护符时已经大于或等于 19，则护符不会起效。

Necklace of Fireballs.name: 火球项链
Necklace of Fireballs.description:
奇物

这条项链上挂着 1d6 + 3 颗珠子。你可以用一个动作取下一颗珠子并投掷到至多 60 尺远的地方。它将在移动轨迹的终点爆炸，效果等同于 3 环的 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ztgcdrWPshKRpFd0]{火球术} （豁免 DC 15）。

你可以在同一次动作中，一次取下并投掷多枚珠子，甚至直接丢出整条项链。同时投掷出的珠子数量每有 1 颗，火球术的环阶也增加 1 环。

Foundry 备注

9充能代表可能存在的最大珠子数量，请根据实际情况调整。"其他公式"按钮可用于投掷额外珠子造成的追加伤害。

根据剩余珠子数量的建议价格表（仅供参考，请 DM 根据世界观调整）：

Number of BeadsPrice (gp)
830,720
715,360

41600
3960
2480
1300

Bravus’s Belt Pouch.name: 布拉维斯的腰包
Bravus’s Belt Pouch.description: 一个材料小包是一个小型的防水皮甲腰带小包，有隔层用来存放施展法术所需的所有材料部件和其他特殊物品，但不包括那些有特定消耗的成分（如法术描述中所指出的）。

Trapped Chest.name: 陷阱宝箱
Trapped Chest.description: 宝箱内衬有一层铅，里边装着 300 GP 和一个黄金酒杯（250 GP）。酒杯上刻着一张悲伤的脸，当酒杯注满时，这张脸会露出微笑。箱中还有一个塞住的骨制卷轴匣，里边放着一张移除诅咒法术卷轴。

Spell Scroll: Arcane Gate.name: 法术卷轴：秘法门
Spell Scroll: Arcane Gate.description:
6 环&Reference[Spell Scroll], Requires Concentration

你创造两个相连的传送门。指定地面上你能看见的两处未被占据的大型空间，其中一点在法术距离内，另一点则在你身边 10 尺内。随后将会开启一个通往两处的圆形传送门，并持续到法术结束。

传送门边缘为闪烁的二维环形，其内布满遮挡视野的迷雾，且整个垂直地悬浮在离地几寸处。传送门单面开启（由你选择），那一面即是传送门生效的一面。

任何进入其中一个传送门的东西将从另一个传送门里出现，如同两个传送门邻接一样。以一个附赠动作，你可以改变其开门的朝向。

affects.special: 一个在 10 尺内，另一个在 500 尺内

Petrified Grung Egg.name: 石化格龙蛙人蛋
Petrified Grung Egg.description:
奇物，（需施法者同调）

该石化格龙蛙人蛋（法力再生珍珠）在你身上时，你可以用一个动作说出珍珠的命令语以恢复一个已消耗的法术位。如果已消耗的法术位为 4 环或更高环阶，则所恢复的法术位为 3 环。使用后直到次日黎明前，珍珠都无法再次启动。

Foundry Note

已设置一个主动效应，为你的角色卡添加毒素伤害抗性。

Poison Damage Resistance.name: 毒素伤害抗性
Poison Damage Resistance.description: 与石化格龙蛙人蛋同调的施法者将获得毒素伤害抗性。

Tiger Eye Gem.name: 虎眼宝石
Tiger Eye Gem.description: 在奥姆城里，在沃伊的皮质腰包里发现的虎眼宝石。

Amethyst.name: Amethyst
Amethyst.description: An amethyst found on a dead templar in the latrines of Camp Righteous.

Mess Kit.name: Mess Kit
Mess Kit.description: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

Potion of Poison.name: Potion of Poison
Potion of Poison.description:
This concoction looks, smells, and tastes like a potion of healing or other beneficial potion.

However, it is actually poison masked by illusion magic. An identify spell reveals its true nature.

If you drink it, you take 3d6 poison damage, and you must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. At the start of each of your turns while you are poisoned in this way, you take 3d6 poison damage. At the end of each of your turns, you can repeat the saving throw. On a successful save, the poison damage you take on your subsequent turns decreases by 1d6. The poison ends when the damage decreases to 0.

Foundry Note

To apply the reduced damage from a successful Constitution save, please use the Other Formula (set at 1d6) as required.

Jewelry Box.name: Jewelry Box
Jewelry Box.description: This cockroach-shaped jewelry box is made of gold, set with precious gems (including tiny black pearls for its eyes).

Pale Green Crystal Eye.name: Pale Green Crystal Eye
Pale Green Crystal Eye.description: You have obtained an eye carved from pale green crystal, discovered in the Golem Pit at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Squash Stew.name: Squash Stew
Squash Stew.description:
The character feels healthier and gains advantage on Constitution saving throws.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) that serves as a reminder but does not automate the aforementioned benefits.

Scarlet Crystal Eye.name: Scarlet Crystal Eye
Scarlet Crystal Eye.description: You found a scarlet crystal eyeball in the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Book of Lore.name: Book of Lore
Book of Lore.description: A book containing historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, myth, or legend.

Folding Boat.name: Folding Boat
Folding Boat.description:
Wondrous item

This object appears as a wooden box that measures 12 inches long, 6 inches wide, and 6 inches deep. It weighs 4 pounds and floats. It can be opened to store items inside. This item also has three command words, each requiring you to use an action to speak it.

One command word causes the box to unfold into a boat 10 feet long, 4 feet wide, and 2 feet deep. The boat has one pair of oars, an anchor, a mast, and a lateen sail. The boat can hold up to four Medium creatures comfortably.

The second command word causes the box to unfold into a ship 24 feet long, 8 feet wide, and 6 feet deep. The ship has a deck, rowing seats, five sets of oars, a steering oar, an anchor, a deck cabin, and a mast with a square sail. The ship can hold fifteen Medium creatures comfortably.

When the box becomes a vessel, its weight becomes that of a normal vessel its size, and anything that was stored in the box remains in the boat.

The third command word causes the folding boat to fold back into a box, provided that no creatures are aboard. Any objects in the vessel that can't fit inside the box remain outside the box as it folds. Any objects in the vessel that can fit inside the box do so.

OCLoYH00QB3gRg0V.name: Emerald
OCLoYH00QB3gRg0V.description: An emerald found in a chest at Firefinger.

Spellbook (1-3).name: Spellbook (1-3)
Spellbook (1-3).description:
Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

This spellbook contains [[/r 1d6]] spells each of 1st through 3rd level.

OwY6ON0Gfhos4Ok0.name: Amethyst
OwY6ON0Gfhos4Ok0.description: An amethyst found in a chest at Firefinger.

Acererak’s Scepter.name: Acererak’s Scepter
Acererak’s Scepter.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended average]].

The scepter is made of solid iron and has an adamantine head.

Cartographer's Tools.name: Cartographer's Tools
Cartographer's Tools.description:
These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade in cartography.

Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Ink Pen.name: Ink Pen
Ink Pen.description: A deviced used in combination with ink to write or draw on a sheet of paper.

Green Crystal Eye.name: Green Crystal Eye
Green Crystal Eye.description: You found a green crystal eye in the Reflected Hall of the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Rotten Leather Quiver.name: Rotten Leather Quiver
Rotten Leather Quiver.description: The rotten leather quiver can hold up to 20 arrows.

Spell Scroll: Tiny Hut.name: Spell Scroll: Tiny Hut
Spell Scroll: Tiny Hut.description:
3rd Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

A 10-foot-radius immobile dome of force springs into existence around and above you and remains stationary for the duration. The spell ends if you leave its area.

Nine creatures of Medium size or smaller can fit inside the dome with you. The spell fails if its area includes a larger creature or more than nine creatures. Creatures and objects within the dome when you cast this spell can move through it freely. All other creatures and objects are barred from passing through it. Spells and other magical effects can't extend through the dome or be cast through it. The atmosphere inside the space is comfortable and dry, regardless of the weather outside.

Until the spell ends, you can command the interior to become dimly lit or dark. The dome is opaque from the outside, of any color you choose, but it is transparent from the inside.

UcZy9DNXQEV848Uy.name: Ruby
UcZy9DNXQEV848Uy.description: A ruby gemstone was found in the Pagoda at Nangalore.

Three-Dragon Ante Cards.name: Three-Dragon Ante Cards
Three-Dragon Ante Cards.description:
This item encompasses a wide range of playing card types, both unmarked and marked.

If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set. Each type of gaming set requires a separate proficiency.

Devlin’s Spellbook.name: Devlin’s Spellbook
Devlin’s Spellbook.description:
This spellbook is a leather-bound tome that contains the following spells:

1st level: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7p9IuWrSWFgfyQo2]{alarm}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4dSvfvTy2ZIJ3K4k]{comprehend languages}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]{detect magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.zPGohqJRir6MyQ3U]{expeditious retreat}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH]{identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.82jM6qD9axLJsTrH]{illusory script}, sleep, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.bnjXlk13ZRJuf5d0]{floating disk}

2nd level: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8cse7rit0oswRPUP]{arcane lock}, cloud of daggers {Player’s Handbook 2014), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.FjYE214HTERCRZNm]{flaming sphere}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1nhIxh0DsJsntCfj]{knock}

3rd level: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8]{dispel magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ztgcdrWPshKRpFd0]{fireball}

Voj’s Spellbook.name: Voj’s Spellbook
Voj’s Spellbook.description:
Found in Obo’laka’s Shrine, the leather-bound spellbook of the Red Wizard Voj contains the following spells:

Cantrips: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.EOmsUcFQJTfG2oio]{fire bolt}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Bnn9Nzajixvow9xi]{light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Utk1OQRwYkMkFRD3]{mage hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.udsLtG0BugXHR2JQ]{prestidigitation}

1st level Spells: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]{detect magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.CKZTpZlxj7hjjo2H]{mage armor}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.41JIhpDyM9Anm7cs]{magic missile}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsterfeatures.Item.yHcr3vlkmtInELj2]{shield}

2nd level Spells: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.wqfAVANuQonNBgnL]{misty step}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.zMAWdyc8UVb37BK4]{suggestion}

3rd level Spells: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Ek45cBpVXvJdv1Qy]{counterspell}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ztgcdrWPshKRpFd0]{fireball}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.yfbK8gZqESlaoY5t]{fly}

4th level Spells: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.tEpDmYZNGc9f5OhJ]{greater invisibility}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WN2LWEljYU6QqnRH]{ice storm}

5th level Spells: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.RpKjTlYASrfqUPVA]{cone of cold}

White Crystal Eye.name: White Crystal Eye
White Crystal Eye.description: You found a white crystal eyeball in the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Archaeologist's Map.name: Archaeologist's Map
Archaeologist's Map.description: A map to a ruin or dungeon.

Spiral Horn.name: Spiral Horn
Spiral Horn.description:
Wand (requires attunement by a spellcaster)

This horn (a wand of wonder) has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges and choose a target within 120 feet of you. The target can be a creature, an object, or a point in space. Roll on the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.X03rbSjVcNNJNqa8]{Wand of Wonder} table to discover what happens.

If the effect causes you to cast a spell from the wand, the spell's save DC is 15. If the spell normally has a range expressed in feet, its range becomes 120 feet if it isn't already. If an effect covers an area, you must center the spell on and include the target. If an effect has multiple possible subjects, the GM randomly determines which ones are affected.

The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into dust and is destroyed.

Red Library Treasure.name: Red Library Treasure
Red Library Treasure.description:
The arcanaloth’s horn-rimmed spectacles aren’t magical, but they are worth 250 gp. The spectacles are also a gate key that opens a portal in the planar city of Sigil. The portal is a two-way door to the plane of Arcadia. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.W4Qx5z0id6da0vqg]{legend lore} spell cast on the spectacles reveals this information and raises their potential value to 2,500 gp if they are sold to a wizard or sage.

The object on the table is a music box made of dark wood with gold filigree. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]{detect magic} spell or similar effect reveals an aura of conjuration magic around it. Each of its five sides is sculpted with the image of a horned woman playing a different musical instrument: a dulcimer, a flute, a harp, a lyre, and a viol. While touching the box, a creature can use an action to make it play music featuring one of the instruments shown, which can be heard up to 60 feet away. The character can also use an action to stop the music. The music box is worth 750 gp.

The library contains two hundred historical texts (50 gp each), sixty tomes of arcane lore (100 gp each), three dusty spell scrolls (create undead, fabricate, and resurrection), and six spellbooks. The first three spellbooks contain 1d6 spells each of 1st through 3rd level. The fourth and fifth spellbooks contain 1d4 spells each of 4th through 6th level. The sixth spellbook has a title (X the Mystic’s Arcane Grimoire) burned into its spine and contains 1d3 spells each of 7th through 9th level.

Robe of Scintillating Colors.name: Robe of Scintillating Colors
Robe of Scintillating Colors.description:
Wondrous item, (requires attunement)

This robe has 3 charges, and it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. While you wear it, you can use an action and expend 1 charge to cause the garment to display a shifting pattern of dazzling hues until the end of your next turn. During this time, the robe sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Creatures that can see you have disadvantage on attack rolls against you. In addition, any creature in the bright light that can see you when the robe's power is activated must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become stunned until the effect ends.

Queen Napaka’s Scepter.name: Queen Napaka’s Scepter
Queen Napaka’s Scepter.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended average]].

The scepter is made of solid iron and has an adamantine head.

Herbalism Kit.name: Herbalism Kit
Herbalism Kit.description: This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to identify or apply herbs. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create antitoxin and potions of healing.

Waterskin.name: Waterskin
Waterskin.description: A leather hide sewn into an enclosed skin which can contain up to 4 pints of liquid. It weighs 5 pounds when full; a pint of water is approximately 1 pound.

Spell Scroll: Lesser Restoration.name: Spell Scroll: Lesser Restoration
Spell Scroll: Lesser Restoration.description:
2nd Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.

Red Crystal Eye.name: Red Crystal Eye
Red Crystal Eye.description: You obtained a red crystal eye discovered in the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

eK7IWNGLlvhAPYIR.name: Quiver
eK7IWNGLlvhAPYIR.description: A quiver can hold up to 20 arrows.

Spell Scroll: Protection from Evil and G.name: Spell Scroll: Protection from Evil and Good (Undead)
Spell Scroll: Protection from Evil and G.description:
1st Level &Reference[Spell Scroll], Requires Concentration

Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: undead only.

The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also can't be charmed, frightened, or possessed by them. If the target is already charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

Ras Nsi’s Spellbook.name: Ras Nsi’s Spellbook
Ras Nsi’s Spellbook.description:
This spellbook is a leather-bound tome, which contains all the spells he has prepared

Cantrip (at will): @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.vrN18tbTw7io5MWd]{chill touch}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.EOmsUcFQJTfG2oio]{fire bolt}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Utk1OQRwYkMkFRD3]{mage hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.kjmjY0zlE6IEiQVL]{mending}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.g2u9PYfqWQAyg9OI]{poison spray}

1st level (4 slots): @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.zPGohqJRir6MyQ3U]{expeditious retreat}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7e3QXF10hLNDEdr6]{false life}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.41JIhpDyM9Anm7cs]{magic missile}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.sSs3hSzkKBMNBgTs]{shield}

2nd level (3 slots): @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.zwGsAv6kmwzYGhh3]{blindness/deafness}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3Lo9boi7P2ro6QV4]{hold person}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.wqfAVANuQonNBgnL]{misty step}

3rd level (3 slots): @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.oyE5nVppa5mde5gT]{animate dead}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Ek45cBpVXvJdv1Qy]{counterspell}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ztgcdrWPshKRpFd0]{fireball}

4th level (3 slots): @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pybg5MNc3lkerH4Y]{blight}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.04nMsTWkIFvkbXlY]{polymorph}

5th level (2 slots): @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.dSTu1MaPhBqPITwM]{contact other plane}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JQyigMNPiDnGI18b]{geas}

6th level (1 slots): @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.E4NXux0RHvME1XgP]{create undead}

Bowl of Commanding Water Elementals.name: Bowl of Commanding Water Elementals
Bowl of Commanding Water Elementals.description:
Wondrous item

While this bowl is filled with water, you can use an action to speak the bowl's command word and summon a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.namJz755U1EhvEJa]{Water Elemental}, as if you had cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1LkZvINag7KqBmDR]{Conjure Elemental} spell. The bowl can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

The bowl is about 1 foot in diameter and half as deep. It weighs 3 pounds and holds about 3 gallons.

Spell Scroll: Create Undead.name: Spell Scroll: Create Undead
Spell Scroll: Create Undead.description:
6th Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

You can cast this spell only at night. Choose up to three corpses of Medium or Small humanoids within range. Each corpse becomes a ghoul under your control. (The DM has game statistics for these creatures.)

As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can mentally command any creature you animated with this spell if the creature is within 120 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you have given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to three creatures you have animated with this spell, rather than animating new ones.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 7th-level spell slot, you can animate or reassert control over four ghouls. When you cast this spell using an 8th-level spell slot, you can animate or reassert control over five ghouls or two ghasts or wights. When you cast this spell using a 9th-level spell slot, you can animate or reassert control over six ghouls, three ghasts or wights, or two mummies.

summon.condition: You can cast this spell only at night.

Vibrant Purple Crystal Eye.name: Vibrant Purple Crystal Eye
Vibrant Purple Crystal Eye.description: You obtained this purple crystal eyeball from I'jin's Tomb, situated in the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Parchment.name: Parchment
Parchment.description: A single sheet of heavier parchment paper.

Spell Scroll: Knock.name: Spell Scroll: Knock
Spell Scroll: Knock.description:
2nd Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

Choose an object that you can see within range. The object can be a door, a box, a chest, a set of Manacles, a padlock, or another object that contains a mundane or magical means that prevents access.

A target that is held shut by a mundane lock or that is stuck or barred becomes unlocked, unstuck, or unbarred. If the object has multiple locks, only one of them is unlocked.

If you choose a target that is held shut with Arcane Lock, that spell is suppressed for 10 minutes, during which time the target can be opened and shut normally.

When you cast the spell, a loud knock, audible from as far away as 300 feet, emanates from the target object.

Bag of Sand.name: Bag of Sand
Bag of Sand.description: A small bag of sand used by the scholarly to dry freshly inked letters and correspondence quickly and safely for quick dispatch.

Orange Crystal Eye.name: Orange Crystal Eye
Orange Crystal Eye.description: You found an orange crystal eye carved from the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Spell Scroll: Remove Curse.name: Spell Scroll: Remove Curse
Spell Scroll: Remove Curse.description:
3rd Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner's Attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

Roast Boar.name: Roast Boar
Roast Boar.description:
[[lookup @name]] feels stronger and has advantage on Strength checks.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) that serves as a reminder but does not automate the aforementioned benefits.

X the Mystic’s Arcane Grimoire.name: X the Mystic’s Arcane Grimoire
X the Mystic’s Arcane Grimoire.description:
Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

This spellbook contains [[/r 1d3]] spells, each of 7th through 9th level.

mPZRoQDDDeURSFwL.name: Sapphire
mPZRoQDDDeURSFwL.description: A sapphire gemstone was found in the Pagoda at Nangalore.

Spellbook (4-6).name: Spellbook (4-6)
Spellbook (4-6).description:
Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

This spellbook contains [[/r 1d4]] spells each of 4th through 6th level.

Scholar's Pack.name: Scholar's Pack
Scholar's Pack.description: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

Ceremonial Dagger.name: Ceremonial Dagger
Ceremonial Dagger.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended average]].

This ceremonial dagger is housed in a gold scabbard embossed with a scene of stampeding jungle animals. It was discovered in Fenthaza’s Quarters at the temple dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Rations.name: Rations
Rations.description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

Malison’s Longbow.name: Malison’s Longbow
Malison’s Longbow.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended average]].

The malison's longbow is intricately painted and carved to resemble a serpent, with tiny amber gemstones serving as its eyes.

Spell Scroll: Comprehend Languages.name: Spell Scroll: Comprehend Languages
Spell Scroll: Comprehend Languages.description:
1st Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any spoken language that you hear. You also understand any written language that you see, but you must be touching the surface on which the words are written. It takes about 1 minute to read one page of text.

This spell doesn't decode secret messages in a text or a glyph, such as an arcane sigil, that isn't part of a written language.

Onyx.name: Onyx
Onyx.description: An onyx gemstone was discovered in the Wreck of the Narwhal.

Sling Bullet +1.name: Sling Bullet +1
Sling Bullet +1.description:
A hardened pebble of stone, bone, or metal which can be flung at high velocity using a sling. It has been imbued with magic.

You have a bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical.

Frothy Beer.name: Frothy Beer
Frothy Beer.description:
The character gains a special die: a d6. Anytime in the next 24 hours, the character can roll this die once and add the result to a d20 roll he or she just made.

Foundry Note

This feature grants an Active Effect (AE) that adds 1d6 to all d20 rolls for the duration of the benefit, including attacks, saves, and checks.

Adamantine Ingot.name: Adamantine Ingot
Adamantine Ingot.description: An adamantine ingot stamped with dwarven runes was discovered in a sack inside Nanny Pu'pu's hut in Mbala.

Spyglass.name: Spyglass
Spyglass.description: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

+1 Yklwa.name: +1 Yklwa
+1 Yklwa.description: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. It costs 1 gp, and it deals 1d8 piercing damage on a hit. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing (range 10/30 ft.).

Black Opal Crown.name: Black Opal Crown
Black Opal Crown.description: The Black Opal Crown was once worn by the archmage Sadamor of Netheril. Legend speaks of how Sadamor saw the depths of humanity’s evil reflected in the opal of his crown. Heartbroken, he created a doomsday device — a sphere of annihilation — to swallow the world but was consumed by his own creation.

Canoe.name: Canoe
Canoe.description: A canoe can be purchased in Port Nyanzaru for 50 gp. It holds up to six Medium creatures and has a maximum speed of 2 mph. It is otherwise identical to a rowboat (see chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide).

Diamond.name: Diamond
Diamond.description: A diamond found amongst the corpse of an adult green dragon better known during her lifetime as Needle.

Random Gemstone.name: Random Gemstone
Random Gemstone.description: While at the Pagoda in Nagalore, you acquire a gemstone.

Gold Bracelet.name: Gold Bracelet
Gold Bracelet.description: While at the Pagoda in Nagalore, you acquire a painted gold bracelet shaped like a couatl.

Gold Chain.name: Gold Chain
Gold Chain.description: A dragon-shaped medal and chain fashioned from gold found in Tinder’s horde.

Gold Dust.name: Gold Dust
Gold Dust.description: Gold dust was found in the washroom at Kir Sabal.

Kurtulmak Statue.name: Kurtulmak Statue
Kurtulmak Statue.description: A 3-foot-tall statue of the kobold deity Kurtulmak, made from various materials such as metal, glass, wood, and stone, was discovered in the Wyrmheart Mine.

Mbala Sack.name: Mbala Sack
Mbala Sack.description: A tied sack made from human skin was found at Mbala. It contains six onyx gemstones (50 gp each), a spell scroll of comprehend languages, and ten adamantine ingots (10 gp each) stamped with dwarven runes.

Medallion.name: Medallion
Medallion.description: Queen Grabsgtab's bronze and adamantine medallion, which you acquired in Yellyark.

toaCh2PagodaBrac.name: Gold Bracelet
toaCh2PagodaBrac.description: A gold bracelet found at a warehouse in the Jahaka Anchorage.

Small Box.name: Small Box
Small Box.description: In Asharra’s personal chamber at Kir Sabal, this small box from under her bed four potions of poison that are easily mistaken for potions of healing.

Tinder’s Horde.name: Tinder’s Horde
Tinder’s Horde.description: Tinder’s hoard contains 3,300 gp, 15,000 sp, 45,000 cp, a gold-embroidered scabbard (25 gp), a dragon-shaped medal and chain fashioned from gold (50 gp), a copper mug with jade inlay (100 gp), and a potion of greater healing.

Turtle Shell Crystal.name: Turtle Shell Crystal
Turtle Shell Crystal.description: A crystal obtained from the shell of a giant snapping turtle found in Snapping Turtle Bay.

Zaroum Al-Saryak’s Coat.name: Zaroum Al-Saryak’s Coat
Zaroum Al-Saryak’s Coat.description: Zaroum Al-Saryak’s coat is adorned with glittering gems stitched into it.

Copper Mug.name: Copper Mug
Copper Mug.description: A copper mug with jade inlay found in Tinder’s horde.

Discarded Backpack.name: Discarded Backpack
Discarded Backpack.description: In the back half of the cave in Mbala are the bodies of two partially eaten explorers. A nearby discarded backpack contains 6 gp, a silvered dagger, and a potion of greater healing.

Electrum Goblet.name: Electrum Goblet
Electrum Goblet.description: An electrum goblet found in a warehouse at Jahaka Anchorage.

Gold-Embroidered Scabbard.name: Gold-Embroidered Scabbard
Gold-Embroidered Scabbard.description: A gold-embroidered scabbard found in Tinder’s horde.

Kakarol’s Horde.name: Kakarol’s Horde
Kakarol’s Horde.description: At the ruined Bazaar in Omu, you find Kakarol’s hoard that contains 30 gp, 250 sp, 1,800 cp, a colored glass statuette of a dragonfly (25 gp), four bloodstones (50 gp each), and a potion of greater healing.

Tiger Eye Gemstone.name: Tiger Eye Gemstone
Tiger Eye Gemstone.description: A tiger's eye gemstone was discovered at Obo’laka’s Shrine.

Dragonfly Statuette.name: Dragonfly Statuette
Dragonfly Statuette.description: At the ruined bazaar in Omu, you find a colored glass statuette of a dragonfly.

Electrum Platter.name: Electrum Platter
Electrum Platter.description: You discovered an electrum platter adorned with Chultan feasting rituals, found at the Amphitheater in Omu.

Decorated Tapestry.name: Decorated Tapestry
Decorated Tapestry.description: At the ruined bazaar in Omu, you found Kakarol wearing a torn tapestry of a macaw, six feet long and decorated with garnet beads.

Amethyst Gemstone.name: Amethyst Gemstone
Amethyst Gemstone.description: You found one of three amethyst gemstones used as the eyes of a froghemoth statuette made of painted wood. It was discovered in Ras Nsi’s lair at the temple dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Amnian Doublet.name: Amnian Doublet
Amnian Doublet.description: You discovered a bejeweled Amnian doublet with a matching money pouch in Ras Nsi’s lair at the temple dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Brass Key.name: Brass Key
Brass Key.description: You found a brass key at the temple of Dendar, the Night Serpent.

Bronze Syringe.name: Bronze Syringe
Bronze Syringe.description:
Xopal carries a bronze syringe that contains three doses of a poisoned cocktail.

As an action, he can make a melee weapon attack with the syringe ([[/attack +3]]{+3 to hit}), which deals [[/damage activity=FOO]] damage and injects one dose of poison on a hit.

Any creature injected with a dose of poison must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average activity=Gp56t5S2YILsDaM9]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

In addition, the creature is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for 1 hour whether or not its save succeeds.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The creature is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for 1 hour whether or not its save succeeds.

Candlesticks.name: Candlesticks
Candlesticks.description: You obtained two golden cobra candlesticks discovered in the harem of the temple dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Ceremonial Bracers.name: Ceremonial Bracers
Ceremonial Bracers.description: You found gold ceremonial bracers shaped like bats at the temple's main gate dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Cormyrean Cloak.name: Cormyrean Cloak
Cormyrean Cloak.description: You found a Cormyrean Cloak in Ras Nsi's lair at the temple dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Crocodile Skin Pouch.name: Crocodile Skin Pouch
Crocodile Skin Pouch.description: Found at the temple's main gate dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent, this pouch is made out of crocodile skin and contains 28gp.

Dendar Holy Symbol.name: Dendar Holy Symbol
Dendar Holy Symbol.description: You obtained Fenthaza’s holy symbol of Dendar the Night Serpent from her quarters at the temple dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Fenthaza’s Chest.name: Fenthaza’s Chest
Fenthaza’s Chest.description: The chest is unlocked and contains 200 gp, a black leather quiver embroidered with a quartz-studded star map (75 gp), and a ceremonial dagger in a gold scabbard embossed with a scene of stampeding jungle animals (25 gp).

Gemstone.name: Gemstone
Gemstone.description: You discovered gemstones in a clay urn located in Ras Nsi's lair, within the temple dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Hand Mirror.name: Hand Mirror
Hand Mirror.description: You obtained Issar's golden hand mirror from the captive's quarters in the temple devoted to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Headdress.name: Headdress
Headdress.description: You acquired Issar's red cloth headdress, adorned with malachite gemstones. The headdress was discovered in the captive's quarters of the temple dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Iron Key.name: Iron Key
Iron Key.description: You found an iron key in the captive's quarters at the temple dedicated to Dendar, the Night Serpent.

Jade Trinket Box.name: Jade Trinket Box
Jade Trinket Box.description: You obtained a jade trinket box shaped like a flytrap, adorned with curling golden leaves, from the harem at the temple dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Large Cushion.name: Large Cushion
Large Cushion.description: You found a large cushion made of Turami silk in Ras Nsi’s lair at the temple dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Moonshae Harp.name: Moonshae Harp
Moonshae Harp.description: You found a Moonshae Harp in Ras Nsi’s lair at the temple dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Ring of Keys.name: Ring of Keys
Ring of Keys.description: You found a ring of keys in Fenthaza’s Quarters at the temple of Dendar the Night Serpent.

Sembian Wine Flask.name: Sembian Wine Flask
Sembian Wine Flask.description: You discovered a Sembian wine flask in Ras Nsi's lair at the temple dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Mesmerizing Incense.name: Mesmerizing Incense
Mesmerizing Incense.description:
Lighting a block of incense creates a hazy cloud that fills a 20-foot-diameter sphere and moves with the block.

Any creature that starts its turn in the cloud and breathes the air must succeed on a [[/save con 16 format=long]] or fall into a dreamlike stupor laced with nightmarish visions. Though it remains awake, the creature is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned}.

Even yuan-ti are vulnerable to this effect, which lasts for 1 hour after a creature leaves the cloud, or until it receives a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{lesser restoration} spell or similar magic.

Dreamlike Stupor.name: Dreamlike Stupor
Dreamlike Stupor.description: The target falls into a dreamlike stupor laced with nightmarish visions. Though it remains awake, the creature is poisoned. Even yuan-ti are vulnerable to this effect, which lasts for 1 hour after a creature leaves the cloud, or until it receives a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{lesser restoration} spell or similar magic.

Tiara.name: Tiara
Tiara.description: You acquired a white gold tiara made from two intertwined vipers with topaz eyes, which was found in the harem of the temple dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Tortoise-Shell Shield.name: Tortoise-Shell Shield
Tortoise-Shell Shield.description: This tortoiseshell shield belonged to Sekelok, the guardian of the armory at the temple dedicated to Dendar the Night Serpent.

Bahamut Holy Symbol.name: Bahamut Holy Symbol
Bahamut Holy Symbol.description: You found a holy symbol of Bahamut on the skeletal remains of a Dragonborn in the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Black Crystal Key.name: Black Crystal Key
Black Crystal Key.description: The recipient gains a charm of nine lives. When you drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. Once used nine times, the charm goes away.

Blue Crystal Key.name: Blue Crystal Key
Blue Crystal Key.description: The recipient gains a charm of the crystal heart. This charm grants you immunity to piercing and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks, but you gain vulnerability to bludgeoning damage. These effects last for 10 days, after which the charm vanishes from you.

Arcane Lore Book.name: Arcane Lore Book
Arcane Lore Book.description: This hardcover book on arcane lore was found in the Red Library at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Bronze Mask.name: Bronze Mask
Bronze Mask.description: You obtained Withers's bronze mask from the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Carnelian.name: Carnelian
Carnelian.description: You discovered a carnelian gemstone in a pouch belonging to a deceased adventurer named Lord Brixton, found in the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Chameleon Statuette.name: Chameleon Statuette
Chameleon Statuette.description: You found a clay chameleon statuette adorned with crystal beads that change colors in the Beholder’s Vault at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Manual of Clay Golems.name: Manual of Clay Golems
Manual of Clay Golems.description:
Wondrous Item

This tome contains information and incantations necessary to make a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.YOqhbf8WsX0jH9Fu]{clay golem}. To decipher and use the manual, you must be a spellcaster with at least two 5th-level spell slots. A creature that can't use a manual of golems and attempts to read it takes 6d6 psychic damage.

To create a clay golem, you must spend 30 days, working without interruption with the manual at hand and resting no more than 8 hours per day. You must also pay 65,000 gp to purchase supplies.

Once you finish creating the golem, the book is consumed in eldritch flames. The golem becomes animate when the ashes of the manual are sprinkled on it. It is under your control, and it understands and obeys your spoken commands.

Gold Cloak Pin.name: Gold Cloak Pin
Gold Cloak Pin.description: You obtained a gold cloak pin found in Papazotl’s Tomb, located at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Purple Crystal Eye.name: Purple Crystal Eye
Purple Crystal Eye.description: You found an eye carved from a purple crystal located in the Reflected Hall of the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

toaCh5Diamond000.name: Diamond
toaCh5Diamond000.description: You have acquired a diamond large enough to serve as a material component for the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.AGFMPAmuzwWO6Dfz]{raise dead} spell.

Eye of Zaltec.name: Eye of Zaltec
Eye of Zaltec.description: For centuries, this fist-sized ruby surmounted the Great Pyramid in Nexal, capital city of the Maztican Empire. The gem is a relic of the cult of Zaltec, and its dagger-like point was plunged into the hearts of countless sacrifices.

Assorted Gems.name: Assorted Gems
Assorted Gems.description: You removed various gems from the tusks of the statue of Ghorm in the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Child’s Bat Mask.name: Child’s Bat Mask
Child’s Bat Mask.description: You found a painted gold mask sized for children, shaped like a bat's face, in the Beholder’s Vault at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Gold Coronet.name: Gold Coronet
Gold Coronet.description: You found a gold coronet shaped like an octopus, featuring mother-of-pearl eyes, in the Beholder’s Vault at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Gold Crystal Key.name: Gold Crystal Key
Gold Crystal Key.description: The recipient gains a charm of treasure sense. While this charm lasts, you can use an action to pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals and stones, such as coins and gems, within 30 feet of you. The effect lasts for 3 days, after which the charm vanishes from you.

Gold Cup.name: Gold Cup
Gold Cup.description: You found a gold cup in Papazotl’s Tomb, located at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Child’s Monkey Mask.name: Child’s Monkey Mask
Child’s Monkey Mask.description: You discovered a painted gold mask, shaped like a monkey's face and sized for children, in the Beholder's Vault at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Child’s Parrot Mask.name: Child’s Parrot Mask
Child’s Parrot Mask.description: You discovered a painted gold mask for children shaped like a parrot's face in the Beholder’s Vault at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Golden Pendant.name: Golden Pendant
Golden Pendant.description: You found a golden pendant shaped like an eye, hanging on the Unkh statue in the Gallery of Tricksters.

Gold Spectacles.name: Gold Spectacles
Gold Spectacles.description: You obtained a pair of gold spectacles in the Veils of Fear located at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Gold Torc.name: Gold Torc
Gold Torc.description: You acquired a gold torc found in Papazotl’s Tomb at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Green Crystal Key.name: Green Crystal Key
Green Crystal Key.description: The recipient gains a charm of the swollen hag. This charm allows you to spit up a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.EZgiprHXA2D7Uyb3]{frog} as an action. The frog understands you and obeys your commands. Once used three times, the charm goes away.

History Book.name: History Book
History Book.description: This hardcover book on history was found in the Red Library at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Horn-Rimmed Spectacles.name: Horn-Rimmed Spectacles
Horn-Rimmed Spectacles.description:
You possess the arcanaloth’s non-magical horn-rimmed spectacles, found in the Red Library at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

The spectacles are also a gate key that opens a portal in the planar city of Sigil. The portal is a two-way door to the plane of Arcadia. Their potential value increases to 2,500 gp if they are sold to a wizard or sage.

Hornet Mask.name: Hornet Mask
Hornet Mask.description: You discovered a golden-painted hornet mask in Queen Napaka's sarcophagus in the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Ivory Back Scratcher.name: Ivory Back Scratcher
Ivory Back Scratcher.description: You found an ivory back scratcher that resembled a dinosaur's claw beside the skeletal remains of a Dragonborn in the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Leather Eye Patch.name: Leather Eye Patch
Leather Eye Patch.description: You found a leather eye patch adorned with a bloodstone in the Veils of Fear at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Gold Leaf.name: Gold Leaf
Gold Leaf.description: You removed the gold leaf from the large mastodon statue of Ghom located in the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Horn-Rimmed Spectacles (Mundane).name: Horn-Rimmed Spectacles (Mundane)
Horn-Rimmed Spectacles (Mundane).description: You possess the arcanaloth’s non-magical horn-rimmed spectacles, found in the Red Library at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Navel of the Moon.name: Navel of the Moon
Navel of the Moon.description: Said to be carved from a chunk of the moon, this polished egg-shaped stone was given as a gift by the ruling syl-pasha of Calimport to his sailor daughter. It is said that anyone who holds the stone can always find the way home to his or her loved ones.

Opalescent Bracelet.name: Opalescent Bracelet
Opalescent Bracelet.description: You discovered an opalescent bracelet made from flail snail shell in Unkh’s Sarcophagus, located in the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Peridot Gemstone.name: Peridot Gemstone
Peridot Gemstone.description: This peridot gemstone was set into a yellow turban found in I'jin's Tomb, located within the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Platinum Hair Pin.name: Platinum Hair Pin
Platinum Hair Pin.description: You acquired a platinum hair pin in the Veils of Fear at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Purple Crystal Key.name: Purple Crystal Key
Purple Crystal Key.description: The recipient gains a charm of the maimed. This charm allows you to regrow a lost appendage or organ, such as an arm, a foot, or an eye. After it is used once, the charm goes away.

Red Crystal Key.name: Red Crystal Key
Red Crystal Key.description: The recipient gains a charm of the ghoul. This charm allows you to use an action to eat a mouthful of flesh from a humanoid that has been dead no longer than 1 day. When you do, you regain 3d8 + 3 hit points. Once used three times, the charm goes away.

Sapphire Cord.name: Sapphire Cord
Sapphire Cord.description: You acquired a sapphire cord that once belonged to the dao Keshma al-Wazir, who was imprisoned in a bottle at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Skeletal Songbird.name: Skeletal Songbird
Skeletal Songbird.description: You found a skeletal songbird in Wither’s office located in the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Belly Button Gemstone.name: Belly Button Gemstone
Belly Button Gemstone.description: You have obtained a topaz belly-button gemstone that once belonged to the dao Keshma al-Wazir, who was trapped in a bottle at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Neverending Ink Pot.name: Neverending Ink Pot
Neverending Ink Pot.description: On Devlin Bashir's body, you have found an ink pot that never runs dry.

Charm of Restoration.name: Charm of Restoration
Charm of Restoration.description: This charm has 6 charges. You can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk]{Greater Restoration} (4 charges) or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{Lesser Restoration} (2 charges). Once all its charges have been expended, the charm vanishes from you.

Clay No-Face's Charm.name: Clay No-Face's Charm
Clay No-Face's Charm.description: While you have Clay No-Face in your possession, you don’t need to eat, drink, or breathe. These benefits last for 30 days while the doll is in your possession, after which the charm vanishes from you.

Essence of Ether (Inhaled).name: Essence of Ether (Inhaled)
Essence of Ether (Inhaled).description:
A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or become &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for 8 hours. The poisoned creature is &Reference[unconscious apply=false]{unconscious}. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Inhaled. These poisons are powders or gases that take effect when inhaled. Blowing the powder or releasing the gas subjects creatures in a 5-foot cube to its effect. The resulting cloud dissipates immediately afterward. Holding one's breath is ineffective against inhaled poisons, as they affect nasal membranes, tear ducts, and other parts of the body.

toaGoldBracelet0.name: Gold Bracelet
toaGoldBracelet0.description: A gold bracelet found at a warehouse in the Jahaka Anchorage.

Gold Tankard.name: Gold Tankard
Gold Tankard.description: You obtained a gold tankard with a sad face that transforms into a smile when filled in the Rotten Halls of the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Insect Repellent Salve.name: Insect Repellent Salve
Insect Repellent Salve.description:
Insect repellent can be purchased in Port Nyanzaru in two forms: blocks of incense or a greasy salve. The merchant prince Kwayothé controls the sale of both. Neither kind of repellent protects against giant insects or the vile swarms of insects described in appendix A of the Monster Manual.

A gourd or vial of salve, which sells for 1 gp, contains 20 applications of odorless grease.

One application protects its wearer against normal insects for 24 hours. The salve is waterproof so it doesn’t wash off in rain.

Mask of the Beast.name: Mask of the Beast
Mask of the Beast.description: This wooden mask is shaped in the likeness of a beast’s visage and has 3 charges. While wearing the mask, you can expend 1 charge and use the mask to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hDOENzjuj5WpLq7B]{animal friendship} spell as an action. The mask regains all expended charges at dawn.

Jade Crocodile Key.name: Jade Crocodile Key
Jade Crocodile Key.description: You discovered a small jade key shaped like a crocodile in the Crypt of the Sun Queen, located at the Tome of the Nine Gods.

Joho's Charm.name: Joho's Charm
Joho's Charm.description: While you have Joho in your possession, it grants you the benefit of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.rY9sRFQp5CFSfsat]{helm of comprehending languages}. This benefit lasts for 7 days while the doll is in your possession, after which the charm vanishes from you.

Talisman of the Sphere.name: Talisman of the Sphere
Talisman of the Sphere.description:
When you make an Intelligence (Arcana) check to control a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.2YNqk5zm9jDTvd7q]{sphere of annihilation} while you are holding this talisman, you double your proficiency bonus on the check.

In addition, when you start your turn with control over a sphere of annihilation, you can use an action to levitate it 10 feet plus a number of additional feet equal to 10 × your Intelligence modifier.

Your Intellegence modifier is [[lookup @abilities.int.mod]]

Bonus: Arcana Check.name: Bonus: Arcana Check
Bonus: Arcana Check.description: While holding this talisman, you double your proficiency bonus on your Intelligence (Arcana) check.

Midnight Tears (Ingested).name: Midnight Tears (Ingested)
Midnight Tears (Ingested).description:
A creature that ingests this poison suffers no effect until the stroke of midnight. If the poison has not been neutralized before then, the creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 (9d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Ingested. A creature must swallow an entire dose of ingested poison to suffer its effects. The dose can be delivered in food or a liquid. You may decide that a partial dose has a reduced effect, such as allowing advantage on the saving throw or dealing only half damage on a failed save.

Moldy Chest.name: Moldy Chest
Moldy Chest.description: Four moldy wooden chests found on the Pinnacle of Firefinger.

Moonstone.name: Moonstone
Moonstone.description: You discovered a moonstone in Shagambi’s Tomb, located within the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Moradin’s Gauntlet.name: Moradin’s Gauntlet
Moradin’s Gauntlet.description: The dwarves of Chult refer to it as Moradin’s Gauntlet, which is typically worn by the overseers of Hrakhamar.

Music Box.name: Music Box
Music Box.description: You found a beautiful music box triggered by the trap in Shagambi’s Tomb, located within the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Onyx Figurine.name: Onyx Figurine
Onyx Figurine.description: An onyx figurine depicting chwingas was discovered in the stirge cave at Firefinger.

Pouch of Assorted Gems.name: Pouch of Assorted Gems
Pouch of Assorted Gems.description: A pouch of assorted gems found on a dead templar in the latrines of Camp Righteous.

Rain Catcher.name: Rain Catcher
Rain Catcher.description: A rain catcher is a simple contraption consisting of a 5-foot-square leather tarp and a wooden frame with legs. When the tarp is stretched across the wooden frame, it forms a basin that can catch 2 gallons of drinking water per inch of rainfall and hold up to 8 gallons. The tarp and wooden frame fold up for easy transport. A rain catcher costs 1 gp and weighs 5 pounds.

toaRuby000000000.name: Ruby
toaRuby000000000.description: A ruby found on a dead templar in the latrines of Camp Righteous.

toaSerpentVenom0.name: Serpent Venom (Injury)
toaSerpentVenom0.description:
This poison must be harvested from a dead or incapacitated giant poisonous snake. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Injury. Injury poison can be applied to weapons, ammunition, trap components, and other objects that deal piercing or slashing damage and remains potent until delivered through a wound or washed off. A creature that takes piercing or slashing damage from an object coated with the poison is exposed to its effects.

Velociraptor Skull Box.name: Velociraptor Skull Box
Velociraptor Skull Box.description: Needle hid the following items in the alcove: a purse made from triceratops hide, a small box made from two velociraptor skulls cleverly fitted together, and a hollow dinosaur bone with a wax plug at one end. The purse contains 55 gp, 800 sp, and three blue quartz rings (10 gp each). The skull box is worth 12 gp and contains a wand of fear and two diamonds (500 gp each). The hollow dinosaur bone contains five +1 sling bullets.

Skull Chalice of Ch’gakare.name: Skull Chalice of Ch’gakare
Skull Chalice of Ch’gakare.description: This jeweled goblet was crafted from the skull of a long-dead Omuan king and served as a symbol of office for the royal line of Omu. The legendary Chultan hero Ch’gakare (pronounced chuh-GAH-kah-ree) is said to have beheaded the king after escaping the Nine Hells on the back of a mastodon.

Strawbundle's Charm.name: Strawbundle's Charm
Strawbundle's Charm.description: While you have Strawbundle in your possession, this charm allows you to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.PQuEgKyCdovOvhqN]{etherealness} spell as an action, no components required. After it is used three times, the charm vanishes.

I'jin.name: I'jin
I'jin.description:
I'jin

(pronounced EYE-jin)

I'jin, the Almiraj, is fickle and unpredictable.

Flaw

While inhabited by I'jin, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: I never stick to a plan.

Power

While I'jin inhabits you, your Dexterity score becomes 23 unless it is already higher.

Kubazan.name: Kubazan
Kubazan.description:
Kubazan

(pronounced KOO-bah-zahn)

Kubazan, the Froghemoth, is wild and spirited.

Flaw

While inhabited by Kubazan, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: I am fearless and not afraid to take great risks.

Power

While Kubazan inhabits you, your Strength score becomes 23 unless it is already higher.

Moa.name: Moa
Moa.description:
Moa

(pronounced MOH-ah)

Moa, the Jaculi, is truthful and kind.

Flaw

While inhabited by Moa, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: I must always speak the truth.

Power

While inhabited by Moa, you can use an action to turn &Reference[invisible apply=false]. Anything you are wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on your person. The effect ends if you attack, cast a spell, force a saving throw, or deal damage.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: Anything you are wearing or carrying is &Reference[invisible apply=false] as long as it is on your person. The effect ends if you attack, cast a spell, force a saving throw, or deal damage.

Nangnang.name: Nangnang
Nangnang.description:
Nangnang

(pronounced NANG-nang)

Nangnang, the Grung, is selfish and cruel.

Flaw

While inhabited by Nangnang, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: I won't share with others.

Power

While inhabited by Nangnang, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You also gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

Nangnang Movement.name: Nangnang Movement
Nangnang Movement.description: You can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You also gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

Obo'laka.name: Obo'laka
Obo'laka.description:
Obo'laka

(pronounced oh-boh-LAH-kah)

Obo'laka, the Zorbo, is nervous and obsessive.

Flaw

While inhabited by Obo'laka, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: I am risk-averse and never deviate from my routine.

Power

While Obo'laka inhabits you, you can attune to one additional magic item. When Obo'laka leaves you, all magic items to which you are attuned are no longer attuned to you.

Additional Attunement.name: Additional Attunement
Additional Attunement.description: You can attune to one additional magic item.

Papazotl.name: Papazotl
Papazotl.description:
Papazotl

(pronounced pah-pah-ZAH-tul)

Papazotl, the Eblis, is shrewd and conniving.

Flaw

While inhabited by Papazotl, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: I bow before no one and expect others to do as I command.

Power

While inhabited by Papazotl, you can't be &Reference[surprise apply=false]{surprised}, you gain advantage on all Wisdom checks, and you never take damage from falling.

Papazotl Awareness.name: Papazotl Awareness
Papazotl Awareness.description: You can't be &Reference[surprise apply=false]{surprised}, you gain advantage on all Wisdom checks, and you never take damage from falling.

Shagambi.name: Shagambi
Shagambi.description:
Shagambi

(pronounced shah-GOM-bee)

Shagambi, the Kamadan, is wise and virtuous.

Flaw

While inhabited by Shagambi, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: I never show mercy to evildoers.

Power

While inhabited by Shagambi, you can make one extra attack when taking the &Reference[Attack] action on your turn.

Unkh.name: Unkh
Unkh.description:
Unkh

(pronounced UNK)

Unkh, the Flail Snail, is self-absorbed and indecisive.

Flaw

While inhabited by Unkh, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: I am incapable of making decisions.

Power

While Unkh inhabits you, your Constitution score becomes 23 unless it is already higher.

Wongo.name: Wongo
Wongo.description:
Wongo

(pronounced WONG-go)

Wongo, the Su-Monster, is violent and erratic.

Flaw

While inhabited by Wongo, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: I act without concern for the well-being of others.

Power

While inhabited by Wongo, you can use your action to unleash a psionic assault on a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[stunned apply=false] until the end of its next turn.

Stunned.name: Stunned
Stunned.description: The target is &Reference[Stunned apply=false] until the end of its next turn.

Tej, Cask (Fort Beluarian).name: Tej, Cask (Fort Beluarian)
Tej, Cask (Fort Beluarian).description: Tej is an amber-colored, fermented drink made from honey. It’s more common and popular in Chult than beer or ale.

Tej, Cask (Port Nyanzaru).name: Tej, Cask (Port Nyanzaru)
Tej, Cask (Port Nyanzaru).description: Tej is an amber-colored, fermented drink made from honey. It’s more common and popular in Chult than beer or ale.

Tej, Mug (Fort Beluarian).name: Tej, Mug (Fort Beluarian)
Tej, Mug (Fort Beluarian).description: Tej is an amber-colored, fermented drink made from honey. It’s more common and popular in Chult than beer or ale.

Tej, Mug (Port Nyanzaru).name: Tej, Mug (Port Nyanzaru)
Tej, Mug (Port Nyanzaru).description: Tej is an amber-colored, fermented drink made from honey. It’s more common and popular in Chult than beer or ale.

Torm Holy Symbol.name: Torm Holy Symbol
Torm Holy Symbol.description: A silver holy symbol of Torm on a leather thong was found on the wall of a burned-out shrine in Camp Righteous.

Torpor (Ingested).name: Torpor (Ingested)
Torpor (Ingested).description:
A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or become &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for [[/r 4d6]] hours. The poisoned creature is &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated}.

Ingested. A creature must swallow an entire dose of ingested poison to suffer its effects. The dose can be delivered in food or a liquid. You may decide that a partial dose has a reduced effect, such as allowing advantage on the saving throw or dealing only half damage on a failed save.

Foundry Note

By default, the duration of the condition is set at a minimum of 4 hours. You can adjust the duration of the Active Effect by opening it up in the Effects tab and then selecting the Duration tab. Change the value (in seconds), then click on Submit Changes.

Poisoned & Incapacitated.name: Poisoned & Incapacitated
Poisoned & Incapacitated.description: The target is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for [[/r 4d6]] hours. The poisoned creature is &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated}.

Wyvern Poison (Injury).name: Wyvern Poison (Injury)
Wyvern Poison (Injury).description:
This poison must be harvested from a dead or incapacitated wyvern. A creature subjected to this poison must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Injury. Injury poison can be applied to weapons, ammunition, trap components, and other objects that deal piercing or slashing damage and remains potent until delivered through a wound or washed off. A creature that takes piercing or slashing damage from an object coated with the poison is exposed to its effects.

Yklwa.name: Yklwa
Yklwa.description: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. It costs 1 gp, and it deals 1d8 piercing damage on a hit. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing (range 10/30 ft.).

Yuan Ti Racial Traits.name: Yuan Ti Racial Traits
Yuan Ti Racial Traits.description:
Darkvision. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Innate Spellcasting. You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.g2u9PYfqWQAyg9OI]{poison spray} cantrip. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hDOENzjuj5WpLq7B]{animal friendship} an unlimited number of times with this trait, but you can target only snakes with it. Starting at 3rd level, you can also cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.zMAWdyc8UVb37BK4]{suggestion} with this trait. Once you cast it, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

Magic Resistance. You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Poison Immunity. You are immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition.

Anthropologist.name: Anthropologist
Anthropologist.description:
You have always been fascinated by other cultures, from the most ancient and primeval lost lands to the most modern civilizations. By studying other cultures’ customs, philosophies, laws, rituals, religious beliefs, languages, and art, you have learned how tribes, empires, and all forms of society in between craft their own destinies and doom. This knowledge came to you not only through books and scrolls, but also through first-hand observation — by visiting far-flung settlements and exploring local histories and customs.

Skill Proficiencies: &Reference[Insight], &Reference[Religion]

Languages: Two of your choice

Equipment: A leather-bound diary, a bottle of ink, an ink pen, a set of traveler’s clothes, one trinket of special significance, and a pouch containing 10 gp

Cultural Chameleon

Before becoming an adventurer, you spent much of your adult life away from your homeland, living among people different from your kin. You came to understand these foreign cultures and the ways of their people, who eventually treated you as one of their own. One culture had more of an influence on you than any other, shaping your beliefs and customs. Choose a race whose culture you’ve adopted, or roll on the Adopted Culture table.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-tomb-annihilation.tables.RollTable.toaAdoptedCultur classes="caption-top" resultLabel="Culture" rollable]

Feature: Adept Linguist

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-tomb-annihilation.items.Item.toabgfFeatureAde caption=false]{Adept Linguist}

Suggested Characteristics

Anthropologists leave behind the societies into which they were born to discover what life is like in other parts of the world. They seek to see how other races and civilizations survive — or why they did not. Some anthropologists are driven by intellectual curiosity, while others want the fame and recognition that comes with being the first to discover a new people, a lost tribe, or the truth about an ancient empire’s downfall.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-tomb-annihilation.tables.RollTable.toaPersonalityTr rollable resultLabel="Personality Trait"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-tomb-annihilation.tables.RollTable.toaIdeal00000000 rollable resultLabel="Ideal"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-tomb-annihilation.tables.RollTable.toaBond000000000 rollable resultLabel="Bond"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-tomb-annihilation.tables.RollTable.toaFlaw000000000 rollable resultLabel="Flaw"]

Archaeologist.name: Archaeologist
Archaeologist.description:
An archaeologist learns about the long-lost and fallen cultures of the past by studying their remains — their bones, their ruins, their surviving masterworks, and their tombs. Those who practice archaeology travel to the far corners of the world to root through crumbled cities and lost dungeons, digging in search of artifacts that might tell the stories of monarchs and high priests, wars and cataclysms.

Skill Proficiencies: &Reference[History], &Reference[Survival]

Tool Proficiencies: Cartographer’s tools or navigator’s tools

Languages: One of your choice

Equipment: A wooden case containing a map to a ruin or dungeon, a bullseye lantern, a miner’s pick, a set of traveler’s clothes, a shovel, a two-person tent, a trinket recovered from a dig site, and a pouch containing 25 gp

Dust Digger

Prior to becoming an adventurer, you spent most of your young life crawling around in the dust, pilfering relics of questionable value from crypts and ruins. Though you managed to sell a few of your discoveries and earn enough coin to buy proper adventuring gear, you have held onto an item that has great emotional value to you. Roll on the Signature Item table to see what you have, or choose an item from the table.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-tomb-annihilation.tables.RollTable.dmgSignatureItem rollable resultLabel="Item"]

Feature: Historical Knowledge

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-tomb-annihilation.items.Item.toabgfFeatureHis caption=false]{Historical Knowledge}

Suggested Characteristics

Few archaeologists can resist the lure of an unexplored ruin or dungeon, particularly if such a site is the source of legends or is rumored to contain the treasures and relics of wizards, warlords, or royalty. Some archaeologists plunder for wealth or fame, while others consider it their calling to illuminate the past or keep the world’s greatest treasures from falling into the wrong hands. Whatever their motivations, archaeologists combine the qualities of a scrappy historian with the self-made heroism of a treasure-hunting scoundrel.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-tomb-annihilation.tables.RollTable.toaTrait10000000 rollable resultLabel="Personality Trait"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-tomb-annihilation.tables.RollTable.toaIdeal10000000 rollable resultLabel="Ideal"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-tomb-annihilation.tables.RollTable.toaBond100000000 rollable resultLabel="Bond"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-tomb-annihilation.tables.RollTable.toaFlaw100000000 rollable resultLabel="Flaw"]

Adept Linguist.name: Adept Linguist
Adept Linguist.description: You can communicate with humanoids who don’t speak any language you know. You must observe the humanoids interacting with one another for at least 1 day, after which you learn a handful of important words, expressions, and gestures — enough to communicate on a rudimentary level.

Historical Knowledge.name: Historical Knowledge
Historical Knowledge.description: When you enter a ruin or dungeon, you can correctly ascertain its original purpose and determine its builders, whether those were dwarves, elves, humans, yuan-ti, or some other known race. In addition, you can determine the monetary value of art objects more than a century old.

Blue Quartz Ring.name: Blue Quartz Ring
Blue Quartz Ring.description: A blue quartz ring found amongst the corpse of an adult green dragon better known during her lifetime as Needle.

Dreaming Tincture.name: Dreaming Tincture
Dreaming Tincture.description:
Any creatures that drinks a dose of the tincture must succeed on a [[/save con 15 format=long]]. Creatures who are immune to the poisoned condition succeed automatically.

On a failed save, the creature begins to experience illusory sights, sounds, smells, and sensations that seem real. Casting a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{lesser restoration} spell or similar magic on the character ends the effect, which otherwise lasts for [[/r 1d4 + 4]] hours.

Omuan Death Mask.name: Omuan Death Mask
Omuan Death Mask.description: You discovered a golden-painted Omuan death mask at the Amphitheater in Omu.

Bloodstone.name: Bloodstone
Bloodstone.description: At the ruined bazaar in Omu, you discover a bloodstone gem among Kakarol’s treasure hoard.

Platinum Armband.name: Platinum Armband
Platinum Armband.description: You acquired a platinum armband engraved with dueling dragons, once owned by the dao Keshma al-Wazir, who was imprisoned in a bottle at the Tomb of the Nine Gods.

Dancing Monkey Fruit.name: Dancing Monkey Fruit
Dancing Monkey Fruit.description:
This rare magical fruit produces enough juice to fill a vial. Any humanoid that eats a dancing monkey fruit or drinks its juice must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or begin a comic dance that lasts for 1 minute. Humanoids that can’t be poisoned are immune to this magical effect.

The dancer must use all its movement to dance without leaving its space and has disadvantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws, and other creatures have advantage on attack rolls against it. Each time it takes damage, the dancer can repeat the [[/save con dc=14]]{saving throw}, ending the effect on itself on a success. When the dancing effect ends, the humanoid suffers the &Reference[poisoned] condition for 1 hour.

Dancing.name: Dancing
Dancing.description:
The dancer must use all its movement to dance without leaving its space and has disadvantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws, and other creatures have advantage on attack rolls against it.

Each time it takes damage, the dancer can repeat the [[/save con dc=14]]{saving throw}, ending the effect on itself on a success.

When the dancing effect ends, the humanoid suffers the &Reference[poisoned] condition for 1 hour.

Menga Leaves (1 oz).name: Menga Leaves (1 oz)
Menga Leaves (1 oz).description:
The dried leaves of a menga bush can be ground, dissolved in a liquid, heated, and ingested. A creature that ingests 1 ounce of menga leaves in this fashion regains 1 hit point. A creature that ingests more than 5 ounces of menga leaves in a 24-hour period gains no additional benefit and must succeed on a [[/save con dc=11 format=long]] or fall &Reference[unconscious] for 1 hour. The unconscious creature awakens if it takes at least 5 damage on one turn.

A healthy menga bush usually has [[/gmr 2d6#Ounces of Menga leaves]] ounces of leaves. Once picked, the leaves require 1 day to dry out before they can confer any benefit.

Ryath Root.name: Ryath Root
Ryath Root.description: Any creature that ingests a ryath root gains [[/heal]]. A creature that consumes more than one ryath root in a 24-hour period must succeed on a [[/save con dc=13 format=long]] or suffer the &Reference[poisoned] condition for 1 hour.

Sinda Berries (Cluster).name: Sinda Berries (Cluster)
Sinda Berries (Cluster).description:
These berries are dark brown and bitter. A full-grown sinda berry bush has [[/gmr 4d6#Berries]] berries growing on it. A bush plucked of all its berries grows new berries in [[/gmr 1d4#Regrowth time (Months)]] months. Picked berries lose their freshness and efficacy after 24 hours.

Fresh sinda berries can be eaten raw or crushed and added to a drink to dull the bitterness. A creature that consumes at least ten fresh sinda berries gains advantage on saving throws against disease and poison for the next 24 hours.

Foundry Note

This item's maximum number of uses, rather than its quantity, is used to track the number of berries available for variable consumption amounts. It has been preset with the minimum number of berries found on a bush.

Disease and Poison Resilience.name: Disease and Poison Resilience
Disease and Poison Resilience.description: A creature that consumes at least ten fresh sinda berries gains advantage on saving throws against disease and poison for the next 24 hours.

Wildroot.name: Wildroot
Wildroot.description: Introducing the juice of a wildroot into a poisoned creature’s bloodstream (for example, by rubbing it on an open wound) rids the creature of the &Reference[poisoned] condition. Once used in this way, a wildroot loses this property.

Wukka Nuts.name: Wukka Nuts
Wukka Nuts.description: These fist-sized nuts grow on wukka trees, which are popular haunts for jaculi, su-monsters, and zorbos. A wukka nut rattles when shaken, causing its shell to shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. This magical light fades after 1 minute, but shaking the nut again causes the light to reappear. If the shell of the nut is cracked open, it loses its magic.

Illuminated.name: Illuminated
Illuminated.description: The wukka nut shell sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. This magical light fades after 1 minute,

Yahcha.name: Yahcha
Yahcha.description: A yahcha (pronounced YAH-chah) is a harmless, meaty beetle about the size of a human hand, which feeds on worms and maggots. It moves slowly (walking speed 10 feet) and is easy to catch. A creature with @UUID[JournalEntry.toaCh2TheLandOfC.JournalEntryPage.cAVQlvTQ3y2Unkni]{blue mist fever} that eats a raw or cooked yahcha can immediately make a saving throw with advantage against that disease (see “@UUID[JournalEntry.toaCh2TheLandOfC.JournalEntryPage.q88gNSLatuxyV9Yg]{Diseases}”).

Zabou.name: Zabou
Zabou.description:
